Name: Listening Lotto: Where is Puppy?
Description:
In this educational children's game, players match images of a dog in relation to its dog house to word escribing that relation ship (inside; on top of). To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear.  Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

Name: Relic Knights: Codifier Togan & Cecilia
Description:
Few of the ancient Imbach race choose to follow the path of the Aethyric Doctrine, finding aethyric patterns to be too fickle to rely on. Togan on the other hand revels in the chaos inherent in the energy that binds the universe together. Cursed with insatiable curiosity and gifted with his races’ naturally long life span, there are few Codifiers in existence who can match his mastery of the Doctrines. Unfortunately, Togan’s curiosity also leads him to become the source of an uncommon amount of mischief. He is banned from as many planets, stations, and ships as any corsair. Many husbands and fathers would like nothing more than to see Togan clasped in irons (or worse) due to his scandalous behavior. Cecilia, his personal Doctrine scribe, follows in his wake desperately trying to make amends and keep the catastrophes contained to disasters.

Codifier Togan and Cecilia are two multi-part pewter miniatures provided with a single 50mm premium base. Models are unpainted and require assembly.

Name: Swordpoint: Medieval Armies
Description:
Army list book containing 48 armies with additional variants, covering the period from 1066 AD to 1526 AD. Army lists include:

Medieval Wales
Medieval Scandinavia
Khwaresmian
Medieval Burmese
Crusading Military Orders
Christian Crusaders
Medieval Russian
Early Holy Roman Empire
Feudal Polish
Medieval Bulgaria
Baltic Pagans
Kingdom of Cilicia
Duchy of Achaia
Muslim Indian
Mongol Conquest and Khanates
Ordenstaat
Medieval Serbia
Medieval Spanish
Medieval Scottish
Mamluks
Medieval Byzantine
Medieval Albania
Ottoman Turks
Swiss
Medieval English
The Catalan Company
Later Medieval Hungarian
Low Countries
Later Italian City States
Aztec Triple Alliance
Medieval French
Medieval Moldavia and Walachia
Timurid
Later Polish
White Company
Ming Chinese
Later Holy Roman Empire
Medieval Persia
Hussite
Incan Empire
Late medieval French
War of the Roses
Ordonnance Burgundian
French Expedition
Spanish in Italy
Renaissance Scots
Imperial
Moghul Conquest
Families: History: Classical Age of the Ottoman Empire

Name: Flick 'em Up!: Giant Edition
Description:
Move over! There's a new sheriff in town! Flick 'em Up! – Giant Edition more than doubles the scale from the classic dexterity game Flick 'em Up! Players will be able to relieve the great Western adventure on an epic scale!

Experienced Flick 'em Up! players will immediately recognize the same great gaming elements you're used to, but now on a larger scale! Both new and old players will immediately appreciate the greatly enhanced gameplay due to the larger play surface and components. Further, the components lend themselves to a more accurate representation of one's skill — the size of the pieces serve as a more natural extension for the player.

Flick 'em Up! – Giant Edition comes packaged in a gorgeous leather suitcase tailored to hold all the game's components.

Name: Kann, le combat
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Kann: le combat is a confrontation game for two players, inspired from Jules Verne's book "20.000 lieux sous les mers".

One plays the "Nautilus" submarine and its crew while his opponent plays the giant Squid.

The Squid player wins if he meets any of these 3 conditions :

     eat the captain of the Nautilus
     eat 3 crew member (out of 10)
     inflict 6 damages to the Nautilus


The Nautilus player wins if he cuts 5 tentacles (out of 6).

Each turn, both player roll two dice and use them on their dashboard in order to trigger various actions.

The Squid can throw ink (an attack meant to deal damages to the Nautilus), gather anger (anger points can be used to influence subsequent dice), deploy or retract his tentacles.
Tentacles do hit the Nautilus when they reach it, and can capture a crew member when deployed inside. In order to be eaten, a captured crew member has to be brought back to the Squid's mouth by retracting the tentacle.

The Nautilus player can move his crew members, rescue a crew member fallen to the sea, improve his moral (moral can influence subsequent dice), repair damages, and attack the Squid with axes, harpoons, or electricity.

Name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box Second Edition
Description:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple is a real-time, cooperative game in which all players must escape from a temple after awakening an ancient curse. Players navigate through the temple by rolling dice and matching symbols to rooms, thereby gaining entry and visibility into adjacent rooms. So the temple "map" randomly unfolds as you explore further...every game is different! But as you explore, don't wander too far! All players must find the exit before the curse seals the adventurers in forever! The real-time aspect is enhanced by a soundtrack that is your timer for the game.

The Big Box Kickstarter Second Edition includes:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Illusions (Expansion 1)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Quest (Expansion 2)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Traps (Expansion 3)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Pit (Queenie 1)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Doomed (Queenie 2)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Fountain (Queenie 4)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Quest Chambers (Queenie 5)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Maze (Queenie 6)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – New Characters (Queenie 7)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Maya Calendar (Queenie 8)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Exchange Chamber and Teleporter Chamber (Queenie 9)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Totem Chamber (Queenie 10)
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Cursed Gems (Queenie 11)
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Anachrony Leader Box
Description:
Anachrony features a unique two-tiered worker placement system. To travel to the Capital or venture out to the devastated areas for resources, players need not only various Specialists (Engineers, Scientists, Administrators, and Geniuses) but also Exosuits to protect and enhance them — and both are in short supply.

The game is played in 4-7 turns, depending on the time when the looming cataclysm occurs (unless, of course, it is averted!). The elapsed turns are measured on a dynamic Timeline. By powering up the Time Rifts, players can reach back to earlier turns to supply their past "self" with resources. Each Path has a vastly different objective that rewards it with a massive amount of Victory Points when achieved. The Paths' settlements will survive the impact, but the Capital will not. Whichever Path manages to collect most points will be the new seat for the Capital, thus the most important force left on the planet...

As stretch goals to the Kickstarter campaign, four Leader Boxes were available as expansions to the base game.  Each Leader box contained everything from the Follower box, plus the Pioneers of New Earth module, the Exosuit miniatures -- all in an exclusive box sleeve based on a chosen Path affiliation.  The four Path affiliations were:  Path of Dominance, Path of Progress, Path of Salvation, and Path of Harmony.

Name: Noch mal!: Zusatzblock I
Description: Noch mal!: Zusatzblock I is a set of new sheets for use with the Noch mal! dice game. The new arrangement of colors provides a new game experience.

Name: 25 to Dice
Description:
Description from the publisher:

25 to Dice is a Roll & Write game for 1 or more players (both Co-operative Mode and Competitive Mode variants provided for multiplayer rules). Your objective is to avoid being captured by guards and escape prison by leading at least 4 inmates to freedom before the shift changes and time runs out.

Each round consists of 2 phases, the first is the Guards Move, then the Inmates Move. During the Inmates Move, your goal is to move at least 4 of your Inmates across the board from their cell at the bottom to one of the 6 exits at the top without being caught by either Guard. Inmates are moved by rolling 6 dice, and spending each die to move an Inmate to an adjacent square with a matching number.

During the Guards Move, 1 die is rolled for each guard and the guard moves along their marked patrol path to the next square with the same number. If a Guard crosses or enters a square that an Inmate has previously passed through, they leave their patrol path and begin following the path left by the Inmate. If the Guard catches up to the Inmate before they are able to escape, they are captured.

The game ends when: 1) 4 inmates successfully escape; 2) 3 inmates get captured; or 3) you run out of time at the end of the 15th round.

Name: Concordia: Aegyptus / Creta
Description:
Concordia: Aegyptus / Creta is an expansion for Concordia that contains two maps for new strategic challenges:


    In Aegyptus, the Nile and its yearly flood brings some extra food. You can also engage yourself in trade with frankincense or gold for sestertii and victory points at the end of the game.
    In Creta, you play on a tight map containing only twenty cities in nine provinces (one with only a single city).


Both maps can be played at all player counts, but become very competitive with four and especially with five players. The maps also have a new format which is a little longer, but clearly smaller than previously released maps.

The two-sided personality card display is separated from the map and contains a side with different additional costs.

Name: Objective Shreveport!
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Designer John Theissen has another compact operational sandbox for ACW gamers to play around in. While the game has some similarities to his MORE AGGRESSIVE ATTITUDES, important differences in scale and emphasis result in a unique experience that's specific to the factors that doomed the Union's 1864 Red River Campaign.

Each side has three Leaders whose presence is generally required to launch an attack, but there the similarities end. The Union army is larger but also more cumbersome, being dependent on slow-moving and vulnerable supply trains. A rigid leadership structure makes coordination difficult, and one of those leaders is going to sit on his hands in Alexandria for the first third of the game instead of advancing toward the Union objective: Shreveport.

The Confederates have less strength points to throw around, but they have a much more flexible command structure, and don't have to worry about their own supply. Slowing the Union advance (not that they need much help) and launching well-chosen attacks, supported by well-timed Special Events cards, is key for the beleaguered butternuts.

Within these parameters, there's ample room for players to experiment, with multiple ways to approach your objectives (and to frustrate your opponent's). There's only a handful of units on each side, but plenty of hexes to maneuver in. It's a challenging game, while remaining short enough to play in a single evening, and simple enough to serve as an excellent introduction to operational scale gaming.

Name: Recycling Route
Description: In Recycling Route, you are a trash-hauling company expanding into recycling markets. Each turn, you’ll roll dice to determine what types of recycling contracts are available in your city -- and your neighbor’s city, as well. Then, steer your truck along a collection route that maximizes revenue while trying not to completely fill up your landfill. The player who makes the most money is the winner of Recycling Route!

Name: Stronghold (2nd edition): The Great Shaman
Description:
The Great Goblin Shaman joins the siege.
 Move into the world of ghosts, resurrect the dead, use their powers, and watch the stronghold fall. This unique add-on will allow the attacker use dead bodies to play black magic, creating new monster and poison.

The invader, instead of rejecting killed units, assigns them to selected shamanic magic effects. This way he gains new opportunities to influence the situation on the board.

Name: Great Pacific War: Co-Prosperity Sphere – A Scenario Book
Description:
Description from the publisher:

In late 1941, Imperial Japan embarked on a suicidal course by launching an aggressive war against the United States. Outmatched in every meaningful category of economic, political and military power, sometimes by astronomical margins, Japan never had a chance to win a military victory in the Second World War. No amount of battlefield valor could change the final outcome and the Empire's defeat was only a matter of time.

Co-Prosperity Sphere is an expansion book for our Great Pacific War game that studies what circumstances might have given Imperial Japan an opportunity to match American power. It’s part of our Long War naval game setting, which includes Second World War at Sea: Plan Z. In this alternative history, Japan has greatly increased her power and rules an Empire of 153 million people while holding firm political and economic dominion over the puppet Chinese Empire as well.

Co-Prosperity Sphere includes six new scenarios and 90 new playing pieces to bring this setting to Great Pacific War. This is not a complete game; ownership of Great Pacific War is required to play these scenarios.

Name: Arith Magica: Adventures in Gossamyr
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Arith Magica: Adventures in Gossamyr is an all-ages friendly board game based on the award winning graphic novel, "Finding Gossamyr". Arith Magica encourages players to solve problems with their minds as well as weaponry. Up to five players choose one of our unique, mathemagically powered heroes and embark on quests and adventure in the glorious land of Gossamyr. Together they will use, modular, double-sided board pieces to explore scorched deserts, illuminated forests and eldritch towers where they will face perplexing puzzles, wield powerful Arithmancy, fire geometric bows, and face the terrible scourge that threatens this beautiful world.

Name: Pirate's Life (fan expansion for Dominion)
Description:
Description from the designer:

This set adds a total of 12 new cards. They were designed when Dark Ages was released and intended to add a few new concepts, to add upon well-established concepts (example: rewarding variety like Menagerie) and to add cards that encouraged more interaction between players (see Ravisher for example).

Many of these cards are playable on their own but shine when paired with certain cards and become impressive combo pieces.

This set is meant to be played mixed with any of the official Dominion expansions.

Name: Der magische Zwergenwald
Description:
A magical play experience for 2 to 4 little dwarves from 4 years. Der magische Zwergenwald ("The magical dwarf forest") is a new children's game by the successful game author Reiner Knizia. Here the children go on an adventurous journey where they try to lead the dwarfs out of the forest on an enchanted path. It is necessary to walk crosswise through the forest, to try out different paths, to visit multiple fields fields, to reveal secret puzzles and to remember well. If you have good tracking skills and do not fall into a trap, the brave dwarves leave the forest and win the game.

–description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Altun Ha
Description:
A card bidding and building game for 2-4+ players themed around the Belize Mayan ruins of Altun Ha, occupied and built up between 200 BC and 900 AD before it was abandoned, probably due to a combination of overpopulation, drought, famine, social unrest, and civil war.

The players share a common deck comprising three types of cards: Bid Cards (also used for building), Trade Cards and Maya God Cards (wild cards).  Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards.

The calendar token is used to keep track of turn order within a round. It is assigned randomly at the start of the game.

Each Round is divided into 8 Phases: 
1.   Calendar Phase - the player with the calendar token passes it to the player to his right. 
2.   Population Phase - the population level increases by 1 (it starts at level 2).  
3.   Draw Phase - each player is dealt 2 cards from the deck. 
4.   Trade Phase - staring with the player with the calendar token, each player may play one trade card from his hand. Trade cards allow players to draw extra cards, look at opponent’s hands, cause opponents to lose scoring points etc.
5.   Bid Phase - all players must bid zero to two bid cards from their hands. Bidding is simultaneous with players revealing their bid cards at the same time. The player with the highest value bid wins the bid and becomes the Priest King. 
6.   Farm Phase - the Priest King must discard 1 or 2 Bid cards with a combined value equalling or exceeding the current population level. If unable to do so, the game ends immediately and the current Priest King loses 13 scoring points. 
7.   Build Phase - The Priest King may play up to 2 bid cards as build cards.  A card of value 1 is placed by itself face-up in the middle of the table and is considered the first stage of a new temple. Higher level bid cards can be added onto already existing temples.  They are placed staggered on the top of a temple with a level 1 less than the card being placed. (i.e. a level 2 card is placed on top of a level 1 card; or a level 6 card is placed on top of a level 5 card). The Priest King gains scoring points equal to the value of the cards he places. If unable to build, he loses 7 scoring points. 
8.   Cycle Phase – maximum hand is 5 cards - players discard excess cards.

The game ends immediately in any turn in which the Priest King is unable to feed his people in Farm Phase. The player with the most scoring points at the end of the game wins.

Name: Cruise Ship Quest
Description:
A board game for 2-4+ players with a Cruise Line management theme.

The map contains 18 regions. Each region directly connects to 1-5 other regions by course lines.  Within each region are 3-5 cities which are connected to each other.

Players share a common deck comprising 5 types of cards: Destination Cards, Room Cards, Mess Cards, Crew Member Cards and Souvenir Cards. The Room cards are further divided into 3 types: Food Cards, Sleep Cards and Play Cards.  Players start with a hand of 7 cards.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 7 Phases:

Itinerary Phase
-   Draw 1 card from the deck and put it in your hand.

Investment Phase
-   You may reduce your Cruise Point score by 1 to draw an extra card. 
-   You may then reduce your Cruise Point score by another 2 to draw a second extra card. (total 3 points)
-   You may then reduce your Cruise Point score by another 3 to draw a third extra card. (total 6 points)

Business Phase
-   Players may trade cards and Cruise Points with each other.

Launch Phase
-   You may launch a new cruise ship. To do this you must play 7 cards from your hands. 6 cards must be Room cards (2 Sleep cards, 2 Play cards, 2 Food cards)
The seventh card is a city card; the location where the ship will start from. 
-   Start a Ship Log for the new ship and select a ship token.  On the log record the identity number of the ship token and, ownership of the ship, its home port (starting location) and its value (based on the total value of the room cards played (each room has a value of 1 or 2)
-   Discard all 7 cards at the end of the phase a ship is launched.

Sail Phase
-   You may move each of your ships on the map. Each of your ships may move once on your turn in this phase. Ships move 4 ways: 
•   Region to adjacent Region (as allowed on the Region connectivity list) 
•   Region to City within that Region. 
•   City to Region that city is in. 
•   City to city within a Region (all cities within a region are connected)

Destination Phase
-   If you have one of your ships at a city, you may play a matching Destination card. 
For example: Your ship is at Cuba on the Map and you play the Cuba card.  You score Cruise Points for arriving at a destination - gain 2D6 Cruise Points and add the value of your ship to get the base number of cruise points earned. 
-   Next, each other player may play one or more Mess cards from their hands against you. You may play crew member cards from your hand to negate Mess cards on a one to one basis. For each Mess card not negated, you earn 1 less Cruise Point. 
-   You may play 1 or more Souvenir cards. Gain 1 Cruise Point for each such card played.  
-   Record on the Ships Log the destination (City) you arrived at and the number of Cruise points you scored. 
-   Discard all cards played.

Port Phase
-   Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards.

The game ends when players have gone through the deck 3 times and a turn starts and there are no cards left to draw. Scoring is then conducted.

The Ship that visits the most Cities gets 25 Cruise Points.
The Ship that visits the most Regions gets 25 Cruise Points.
A Ship that visits a city no other ship has visited gets 10 Cruise Points for each such city. 
When a ship visits all the cities in a single region, this is called a Hat Trick. A Ship gets 10 Cruise Points for every Hat Trick it Makes.

The player with the most Cruise Points at the end of the game wins.

Name: Iron Fists of Our Fathers II: Battle of Laocai
Description: This is an wargame of Battle of Lao Cai during the Sino-Vietnamese War 1979, and the first game of War Drum Games' Sino-Vietnamese War trilogy.

Name: Dragon Rush
Description:
Mama dragon has four little babies, and she is spreading a rain of gems and coins to feed them with their magic energy. The little dragons must gather them to grow and become the king of the cavern. The dragon rush has begun!

Dragon Rush is an abstract board game for 1-4 player, with a duration of 30-60 min. Players must drop the gems/coins and form rows or diagonals of the same type in order to explode them and get points.

•••

Mamá dragón ha tenido cuatro lindos dragoncitos, y ha comenzado a esparcir una lluvia de gemas y monedas para alimentarlos con su energía mística. Los pequeños deben reunirlas para crecer y convertirse en el rey de la caverna. ¡La carrera de dragones ha comenzado!.

Dragon Rush es un juego abstracto para 1-4 jugadores, con una duración aproximada de 30-60 minutos. Los jugadores deben soltar las gemas y monedas con las que formar líneas y diagonales, explotando para obtener puntos.

Name: Starweb
Description:
Starweb is a placement game without movement or capture. Players take turns to place one stone. The starshaped board has 18 corners, 12 outward and 6 inward ones. Groups containing corners have a value of 1 point for one corner, 2 points for the second corner, 3 for the third and so on. A group containing 4 corners thus has a value of 1+2+3+4=10 points. This 'triangular' score makes connecting groups very advantageous.
The game starts with the pie rule and ends when both players pass on successive turns. The player with the highest score wins. In case of an equal score the player who placed the second stone on the board wins.

Name: The Voyages of Marco Polo: Agents of Venice
Description: Agents of Venice, the first full expansion for The Voyages of Marco Polo offers modular add-ons to the base game.  Foremost is the option to add another player.  There is also the City of Venice, which offers more spots for players to gain bonuses and city actions, and comes with its own movement system.  The Companion module offers players to take an action to acquire a Companion, who can bestow additional powers for the player's entire Round.  New contracts, goal cards, and city actions and bonuses, as well as 5 new characters are also offered to expand the variety of the base game.
Families: Game: The Voyages of Marco Polo

Name: Mystic Vale: Sunshard Glebe
Description:
The Sunshard Glebe is a promo pack that was sent out to people who filled out a survey about Mystic vale.

The Sunshard Glebe advancement has a cost of seven mana. It provides five mana, as well as two victory points at the end of the game.

The promo pack includes 3 Sunshard Glebe advancements (one advancement for the top, middle, and bottom slots).

Name: 150th Limited Edition Canadian Trivia
Description: This is a Canada-based trivia game released to coincide with the nation's 150th anniversary in 2017. It is a simple game where players or teams compete to cross the nation (board) on dedicated paths by answering trivia questions correctly.

Name: Loot the Body!
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Explore, collect treasures, and change fate with the help of a little magic. Loot the Body! is a strategic family game for 2 - 5 players. Gameplay is a competitive cooperative style with players working together to survive while trying to out do each other and collect the most loot.

Every game is different with a central dungeon built from 36 different cards. Dungeons always include 3 boss monsters and a random selection of 12 other cards.

Players take turns revealing the central dungeon card. All players simultaneously play an action card and draw their hands back up. After all players have placed a card, the Action cards are revealed and effects take place. Players that are last to draw a new card always suffer a small penalty. Monsters that aren't destroyed get to fight back.

Loot the Body is full of fast action and split second decisions that keep everything moving and fun no matter how many times you've played before. The base game also includes some rule variants for players that want even more chaos as they fight to survive and gain loot.

Name: BrazChess
Description:
BrazChess is a Chess-like game that combines in its design several elements found in other games of its kind (like Modern Chatranj, Makruk, Shogi and FIDE Chess) along with brand new ideas to provide a unique experience to the players.

Pieces are weaker than in FIDE Chess, but stronger than in Modern Shatranj and Makruk - so the game fits as another bridge between these games and regular Chess. Even though the game has the same number of pieces that there is in Chess (32), there is a slightly greater variety of them in BrazChess (8 against 6 in Chess). Some of the "parachuting" that occurs in Shogi is present (regarding the movement of Grand Dukes - a promoted Pawn); you'll also find different forms of capturing (suicidal attacks and the Grand Duke's Zone of Control). Also present is the concept of passing your turn.

What you need to play it:
In order to play BrazChess, you will need:
A) The rules (see Files);
B) A Modern Chess board (8x8) and Pieces (you'll need to either paint the heads or bases of two Pawns from each side, or use some other Pieces to represent the 2 Lords from each side). Note that the starting position of some pieces (like the Rooks) is different than in regular Chess;
C) 6 different pieces, coins, tokens or even checkers pieces (for the promoted Pawns aka Grand Dukes);
D) 1 tokens to represent Passing; 
E) An auxiliary board (the Duchy) or a designated space on the table.

The creation of this game was inspired by Chatranj, Modern Chatranj, Makruk, Shogi, Chess/Orthochess (FIDE Chess) and the book "Encyclopedia of Chess Variants" - by D. B. Pritchard. While it is true that there are several Chess-like games like this in the World, Chess is, itself, a variant of an older game, that was already a variant of an even older game. BrazChess, while definitely a member of the Chess family of games, has many unique features that will certainly deliver a different experience than the other games of its kind.

Name: Rebels of Ravenport
Description:
Description from the publisher:

It's a troubled time in the town of Ravenport. A band of monsters has pressed past the guards at Bronze Valley South and made a new home in the once peaceful seaside town. Most of the villagers run in fear of the monsters and their powerful overlord, but not all are so timid. Small forces are resisting the rule of the intruders, taking down the monsters one by one. As they fight, they gain reputation throughout the town and attract new fighters to join their cause. These are the Rebels of Ravenport.

Players take the role of guild leaders who must defeat the monsters and expand their guild. Each player starts off with a small guild of 3 rebels, and can attack one monster each turn. They roll the 3 dice to determine how much damage they deal against the monster. Each rebel deals 1 to 3 damage when a specific number (1 through 6) is rolled. To defeat the monster, they must deal damage greater than or equal to the monster's health. If successful, the guild gains reputation and victory points.

The game board displays the monsters and contains 5 face up cards that the players may acquire. Cards come in two categories - rebels and artifacts. Each turn the players can use their reputation to buy one of these cards, and then replace the empty card slot with the top card of the deck.

Their are two ways for the game to end, so players must strategize toward one (or both) of the goals. First, a guild can select to attack the mighty overlord (who has 12 health) on their turn. If they defeat him, they win the game. Alternatively if the victory point pool is depleted before the overlord is defeated, the player with the most points is the winner. The game is setup with an amount of victory points equal to 10x the amount of players in the game. Points are obtained by defeating monsters, by acquiring cards, and through various card abilities. This two-goal setup creates tension between the players, with some building heavy damage in an attempt to take down The Overlord before the others take the final victory point.

Name: Futbolmesa
Description:
In this football simulation, two players use tactics, strategy, and luck in order to compete to score goals.
The match is developed in a square grid, in which the 22 players move and shoot according to their own statistics. The ball is placed at the intersections of the grid. Penalty kicks, goalkeeper movement, tactical fouls, combined attacks, head kicks, etc., are some of the possibilities.

Name: Lazer Ryderz: Captain Cosmic and The Visionary
Description:
Offered as rewards for backers of the Kickstarter, Lazer Ryderz: Captain Cosmic and Visionary offer different powers for two of the four player characters:


    Captain Cosmic blasts through space as a Lazer Ryder, seeking to unlock the power of the ancient Prizms. Other Ryderz beware as Captain Cosmic's powers allow him to create golden constructs in space that can block travel or even cause a crash!



    Vanessa Long has traveled through time and space as The Visionary! Now, she takes to the cosmos in search of prizms of power to aid her and her allies on earth. Her mental powers allow her to neutralize prizms, making her a psychic force to be reckoned with. Through a combination of psychic befuddlement and raw telekinetic force, The Visionary can move a power prizm she controls out of the grasp of her enemies.

Name: Fate of the Elder Gods: Azathoth
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Offered as a promotional reward for backers of the Fate of the Elder Gods Kickstarter.

As the ruler of the Outer Gods, Azathoth's greatness is reflected in the special passive ability of his Dark Gift - Elder Signs only make him more powerful! When serving Azathoth you'll be begging other Cults to visit the Streets of Arkham and send those pesky Investigators your way to Hasten Doom!

(From Kickstarter Update #36:)

About Cult Cards, Azathoth, and the Promotional Monsters

[...] As for Azathoth, you all can feel free to include Az in games of Fate of the Elder Gods. But be warned—Azathoth is intended for advanced play! Azathoth has a very unique passive Dark Gift ability that can be incredibly tricky to control and/or stop if you’re not familiar with how Fate of the Elder Gods plays. We would recommend not including Azathoth in your first couple of games. Later, you’ll find this pesky Elder God a rewarding puzzle to add some variety.
Families: Game: Fate of the Elder Gods
Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Fate of the Elder Gods: Promotional Cult Cards
Description:
(From the Kickstarter Project page:)

A 12-card pack offered as a reward to backers of the Fate of the Elder Gods Kickstarter campaign.

These cards can be added to any game and grant even more power to your Ancient One! There is a Cult card for every god in the base game and the Beasts From Beyond expansion, as well as one for the promo god Azathoth. There are even a couple of unaligned Cult cards for even more variety!

Brothers of the Black Pharaoh (Nyarlathotep)
Conclave of the Ancients (Your Choice)
Cult of the Yellow Sign (Hastur)
Druids of the Solstice (Tsathoggua)
Esoteric Order of Dagon (Cthulhu)
Followers of the True Fate (Your Choice)
Order of Ancient Secrets (Bokrug)
Order of the Eternal Sacrifice (Your Choice)
Seekers of the Northern Light (Ithaqua)
The Order of Eight (Atlach-Nacha)
The Order of Merlin (Azathoth)
Wizards of Celestial Secrets (Yog-Sothoth)

This promotional pack will not be available in retail and is a little something special to say thanks for supporting the Kickstarter.

(From Kickstarter Update #36:)

Many of you have asked about the Cult Cards that come with the Kickstarter edition and how they should be used in games of Fate of the Elder Gods. The Cult Cards are meant to be supplemental powers for your Cults during the game.

During set-up, all players must agree to use the Cult Cards. Beginning with the player who will take the last turn and proceeding in reverse turn order, each player will choose whether to use the Cult Card associated with their particular Elder God or choose one of the general, unaffiliated Cult Cards. During the game, players may activate their Cult abilities at any appropriate time as stated on the card. This ability does not have to be activated by The Ceremony like an Elder God’s Dark Gift.

[...] We also recommend that you do not include Cult Cards or the Beasts From Beyond expansion in your first games of Fate of the Elder Gods. There are plenty of awesome things to do and explore in just the base game. Once you all know the ropes, you’ll be ready to tackle the extra challenges!
Families: Game: Fate of the Elder Gods
Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Team Yankee: Red Thunder – Soviets in World War III
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Team Yankee is a tabletop miniatures wargame that is set in a fictional World War III in 1985 based on the novel of the same name by Harold Coyle.

The game is a standard two player miniature wargame with each player taking command of a company or battalion level force consisting of hand painted miniatures. The game provides one 6 different missions for the purpose of pickup games. There are also several scenarios in the book that allow the players to recreate some of the battles from the Team Yankee novel.

The game has an accompanying line of 15mm scale miniatures to use but it can be played with models from any manufacture.

Red Thunder introduces new Soviet vehicles. First and foremost is the T-64 tank. The T-64 is a more sophisticated tank than the T-72. It comes with its own optional anti-tank guided missile that is fired through its 125mm 2A46 smooth-bore gun.

Red Thunder also introduces the BTR-60 mounted Motor Rifle Battalion and Companies. The BTR-60 is an 8-wheeled armoured personnel carrier mounting 14.5mm and 7.62mm machine-guns in its small turret.

Red Thunder is also packed full of other stuff. There are three Scenarios that can either be played as one off games or as part of a three game campaign. The book also covers the exploits of the 2nd Guards Tank Army, 94th Guards Motor Rifle Division and Major Yuri Volkov’s Tank Battalion during World War III, plus lots of other background and technical information.

Name: Lady Godiva
Description:
This little card game is based on the story of Lady Godiva (and Peeping Tom).

There are 36 cards in total: 28 number cards, 7 Lady Godiva cards, and 1 Peeping Tom card. Note that number cards are arranged in a pyramid style (or "Dalumuti" style): seven "7" cards, six "6" cards, five "5" cards. etc.

At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt with certain number of cards. The first player to empty his or her hand without being eliminated is the winner.

On a player's turn, he can either pass or play some cards. If he passes, he does nothing: it is simply the next player's turn. If he chooses to play, he lays down one or more cards and announces a number, which is seven or lower. For example, if he announces "six" and plays 3 cards face down, he is claiming that those 3 cards are all number "six" cards.

If no one challenges, it is the next player's turn. The next player has to either pass or play some cards, just like the previous player, but he must announce a lower number than what the previous player claimed.

If someone decides to challenge ("Peep"), she opens the cards played by the current player. If the challenge fails (i.e., the challenged player was honest), the challenger should take all the cards played so far. If the challenge succeeds, the challenged player should take all the cards played so far (or will be eliminated from the game immediately if there is any Lady Godiva card among the played cards).

Play continues in this manner until there is a single winner.

Name: Kalteva torni
Description:
Kalteva torni is a dice game for 2-4 players. The game consists of 4 dices and 24 diagonal cylinder pieces in 4 different colors.

Each player gets 6 diagonal cylinders and a dice. Players roll dice and the highest number starts. Then players roll dice and start to build a tower. Each round cylinder pieces are added to the tower according to the dice roll.

The game ends when:

     one of the players has none of the cylinder pieces left without knocking the tower down. Other players count their left over cylinders and get a point for each.
     the tower is knocked down. The player who knocked it down gets one point for each cylinder in the tower and other players get a point for every cylinder they have left.


The game is played multiple rounds which are determined before the game starts. After every round the points are counted and the player who has the least points at the end of the game wins.

Name: Massive Darkness: A Quest of Crystal & Lava
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Singing Mountain is a dormant volcano that's well-known for having a system of crystalline and lava-filled tunnels beneath its flanks. It has long been a destination for lovers and artists, looking to find inspiration in its "singing" hallways — but now the Darkness has infiltrated its passageways. Who will go in and root out this evil?

Massive Darkness: A Quest of Crystal and Lava, a six-quest campaign for Massive Darkness, takes players down into the heart of the Singing Mountain, looking to cleanse the mountain of the monsters that have taken up residence there. The set includes 15 double-sided tiles to use during the campaign and allows players to expand their other games of Massive Darkness.

Name: Time Dice
Description:
In Time Dice, you represent an independent group bent on setting history right! You seed history with events and then correct those events for the betterment of humanity. But remember: time marches on and the future can be fickle! You must use your resources to change the past and protect the future while not causing too many paradoxes!

The goal of the game is to manipulate the past and present to secure objectives. Each game has 11 objectives you can satisfy. The player with the most satisfied objectives and fewest paradoxes creates the most stable timeline and is declared the winner.

The game is played over six rounds, each consisting of rolling five dice - keep four to use as your Alteration Values to change history and one to seed as your next event in the timeline. Be careful! The ripples caused by certain Alteration Values can affect more than just the present! Can you master the past to perfect the future and secure all of your objectives?

Name: Cthulhu Quest
Description:
A card game for 2-4+ players with a Cthulhu theme.

Players share a common deck comprising 10 card types: Investigator, Ally, Object, Book, God, Monster, Location, Transport, Spell and Event.  Each player is dealt a hand of 13 cards.

Players take turns with each turn having 4 phases:

Investigation Phase
-   Draw 2 cards from the deck and put them in your hand.

Insanity Phase
-   You may discard 1 card from your hand for its effect (e.g. discarding a Transport card allows you to look at the next 5 cards in the deck and keep one; discarding a God card allows you to discard your hand and draw 9 new cards).

Story Phase
-    You may play a Meld. A Meld must include the following: 1 Investigator card, 0 to 2 Ally cards, 0 to 1 Object card, 0 to 1 Book card, 0 to 1 God card, 1 to 2 Monster cards, 1 to 2 Location cards, 0 to 1 Transport card, 0 to 1 Spell card, 0 to 1 Event card.
-   Melds score story points for the number of cards in the meld (3 cards is worth 2 Story Point (SP), 4 cards is worth 4 SP, 5 cards is worth 6 SP and so on …..). Certain card combinations will award extra Story Points.

Mythos Phase
-   If you played a Meld this turn, draw X cards where X is the number of cards in the Meld.  Max hand size is 13 cards - discard excess cards.

The game ends when there are no cards left in the deck and no one can play a Meld. The player with the most Story Points (SP) wins.

Name: Brainbox: Paris
Description:
Do you know how high the Eiffel Tower is in metres? Or where Napoleon I and his wife were crowned in 1804? Find out in BrainBox Paris On-The-Go, which contains 35 beautifully-illustrated cards showing the very best Paris has to offer, and then some!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Name: Torch Carriers
Description:
A party of heroic adventurers arrive at the entrance of the dungeon armor shining, weapons bristling, and trusty Torch Carriers in tow. The great doors open reluctantly then slam shut with a boom once the group is inside. A lock clicks into place locking the group in the darkness. The Torch Carriers light up their torches and shoulder their packs. The heroes quickly scan the entry and seeing nothing threatening sheath their weapons and stride toward the single arched doorway on the opposite side of the room. At the midpoint of the room the floor begins to glow as inscribed runes and markings fade into view. With a soundless flash the heroes are vaporized leaving behind a small cloud of cinders drifting through the air like dying fireflies.

Once the Torch Carriers get past the stunned silence of their hero's’ demise, they decide to complete the task set before the heroes, find the dungeon exit and return home!

You play the part of the Torch Carriers. Unlike most dungeon crawlers, your character is not an epic hero trained in unique skills, covered in protective armor and armed to the teeth with custom weapons. The Torch Carriers have a pack of basic supplies and a torch. In order to survive the dungeon, complete the task, and escape you will have to use what you can find as you go.

Torch Carriers is a “diceless” dungeon-crawling party-based adventure game for 1-6 players. The Chapter-based story system ensures that no two games will ever be alike.

Built on Wrectangle Games “Card Chaos” Gameplay Engine, Torch Carriers allows you to play world-class RPG adventures dictated by the cards you draw rather than the dice you roll.

Name: East Indiamen
Description:
Players are English merchants circa 1590 - 1600’s financing marine voyages to seek treasure in India and SE Asia.

Each player may have a max of 4 expeditions in play at one time. Each expedition must have one or more (to a maximum of 4) ships.   Expeditions can also have trade goods or silver to trade for cargo. They can also have gifts to give to foreign rulers, and great Captains to improve their chance of success. Expeditions are created using cards drawn from an “expedition” deck of 60 cards.

Each player has an expedition mat divided into 4 sections numbered 1 to 4. These correspond to each of the 4 possible expeditions the player may have going at the same time.  The expedition and treasure cards of a particular expedition are placed in its own section.

Play is conducted on an expedition track that is 40 spaces long. There is a start space (England) and an end space (Pacific Ocean).  The spaces in between represent locations or event that may a have a positive, negative or no effect on the expedition. When starting out, an expedition moves towards the end space.  When reaching the End space or any point before then, the expedition may turn back. When an expedition finally returns, its treasures go into the expedition’s profit pile, and all its expedition cards are discarded.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 3 phases:

Expedition Phase

     Draw 2 cards from the expedition deck and discard 1 of them.  Add the card to your expedition pile. 


Launch Phase

     If your expedition pile contains at least 1 ship, you may launch an expedition. 
     If your expedition pile has 8 cards you must launch, unless you don’t have a ship, in which case you must discard your entire expedition pile, and gain 1 treasure. 
     Place an expedition counter onto the start space of the expedition track and place all the expedition cards from the pile into the corresponding section of your expedition mat. 


Action Phase

     In order of expedition number, move your expeditions along the track by rolling 1D6 and moving the expedition that number of spaces. Each space offers one possibility, helpful, or hurtful: trade, resupply, hardship, storm, capture ship, gift, cotton or naught. Spaces are resolved accordingly.


The game ends after 2 hours, or when the treasure deck runs out. The player with the most Treasure Points (TP) in their profit pile at that time wins.

Name: Arguendo
Description:
'Let your inner demons out to play'

A party card game of polemics and moral descent.

Suspend your moral and ethical values in this adult card game, where players argue against each other to defend a host of depraved and damnable acts.
Choose a sinful scenario from the stack of Case Cards and play devil’s advocate to fabricate a winning case, or inflict an unholy deed on your opponent and watch him squirm before the Judge!
Not for the pure or faint-hearted, this game will test the limits of the unscrupulous mind.

Features:
178 Case Cards featuring possible scenarios.
20 Clause cards.
Game Rules
Small size box suitable for travel and social gatherings

Name: Rail Raiders Infinite: Huckleberry's Riverboat Roll
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Huckleberry's Riverboat Roll is an exciting addition to the sci-fi western board game, Rail Raiders Infinite. When players are ready to take a break from snagging booty and ducking the Lawbots in Rail Raiders Infinite, they can gather around the poker table and play to take their fellow player's double dollars.

Huckleberry's Riverboat Roll is a betting dice game, the object of the game is to win every other player's $$ tokens, using the custom poker dice. Players achieve this by playing a series of rounds, where players roll their dice and build a hand, bet on the hand, and then either win by having the best hand or by having every other player fold. Players' hands stay hidden behind the beautifully illustrated double-sided dice blinds and are only revealed once the betting is done.

Name: Expedition: The Horror
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The first expansion to Expedition: The Roleplaying Card Game.

Battle against all-new Cthulhu-inspired enemies and grow your character with the new "Persona" mechanic. Will your adventurer be brave and bold in the face of danger, or will cower in fear and hopelessness?

As your persona changes through abilities, enemies and the story, your adventurer could burst forth in courage, dealing extra damage or boosting allies. Or, as you suffer from stress and fear, you could suffer roll penalties or take additional damage.

Name: The Junior Bible Game
Description:
This game is the Junior Edition of The Bible Game.

From the instructions:
The Junior Bible Game will be a welcome addition to any family, Church, or Sunday School group. The game provides an opportunity to learn the Bible in a fun and challenging way.
Families will especially appreciate the 5 different levels, allowing young children to play alongside older brothers and sisters. Sunday School and Junior Church leaders will find the game to be a popular addition to their program.

There are a total of seven categories in The Bible Game:
1 Life of Christ
2 New Testament
3 Old Testament
4 W.W.W. (Who am I? Where is it? Women of the Bible)
5 Quotes
6 Alpha and Omega
7 General Knowledge

Name: UNO: Paw Patrol
Description:
This is a Paw Patrol version of the classic UNO game.
It has all the same card types of the original game, plus a unique "Silver Badge" card which forces the next player to draw until he reaches a card with a picture of Chase, Rubble or Marshall.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Neon Dawn
Description:
Neon Dawn is a character building, open-world, post-apocalyptic adventure board game for 1-5 players.  It is set in the Waste, a post nuclear land steeped in radiation and full of danger, adventure and treasures to be found.  The Great War happened long enough ago that no one alive remembers what life used to be like.  Those that cling to life work hard to simply survive, overcoming challenges within the Waste every single day.  This is where you intend to make a name for yourself.  Your goal is to explore and survive the Waste, while becoming the most famous adventurer in the process!

Neon Dawn is an adventure game at its core, including 400 mini stories that can be experienced by adventurers of the Waste.  Players initially build out their character through a draft, then continue to develop their character through Items, Consumables and Traits obtained during game play, as well as the Companion you choose to adventure with.  Players can explore the world, salvage materials, build reputation with settlements, trade, craft Items, build buildings (for Fame and reputation) and complete Missions.

Neon Dawn was designed to be easy to learn, yet still provide deep game play and a thematic story experience.  Due to the variance in the cards, map tiles and dice rolls, each play through of Neon Dawn will provide a unique story experience specifically for the players at the table.  No two stories will be alike! (statistically, it's nearly impossible)

Name: Quirky
Description:
Quirky is a fast-moving, quick-thinking, fun, question and answer, bluff and banter game for family and friends. It is not like a conventional fact-based quiz - in this game you decide the answers.

On your turn you answer against a 40-second sand timer and, if you don't know, try to convince others that you do. Younger players compete on equal terms as quick wit and cheeky confidence are more important in the game than knowledge.

You win the cards you answer, unless your answer is challenged, then the winner of the challenge keeps that card and steals another.

If you can't answer you don't pass - you roll the QUIRKY die for a chance to win the card anyway, and if you lose you can choose who it goes to.

A distinctive feature of the game is that many of the answers will vary according to who is playing, when and where.


    For family and friends aged 10 years to adult
    1152 questions
    Game time recommendation 30 minutes, but you can decide that too.

Name: Unexploded Cow: Around the World
Description:
In this small promotional expansion an alternate city deck is provided. 
These cards can be used instead of the ones provided with the game. This deck has 10 cards in it. These could even be shuffled in for an even longer campaign of find land mines with mad cows (however, the card backs are different from those in the base game).

The new cards are:

     Cairo (2): Take any cow from the discard pile and play it into another player's herd.
     Istanbul (3): You may take any number of Spies from the table into your hand.
     London (4): Every player with at least one card in their hand passes one card to the left.
     Los Angeles (1): Take 200 from every player.
     Moscow (1): Draw four cards. Pass one of them to the player on your left.
     New York (2): Take 400 from another player.
     Paris (4): Choose a random card from the normal city deck and follow its instructions.
     Rome (5): Every player who has at least one cow passes one cow to the left.
     Sydney (3): Swap hands with another player.
     Tokyo (5): Take 200 from the pot. Put any cow on the table into the discard pile.

Name: Saboteur: The Wardrobe Cavern
Description:
This postcard sized expansion is placed 4 cards away from the starting card in such a way that it is also one card away from center goal card. 
The first player to connect to this card is immediately forced to exchange their role card. They place their card back in the box and take the one that was set aside(saboteur base game) or a new card of the leftover roles cards from the deck (Saboteur 2)

Name: Clank!: Friendly Watcher
Description:
Promotional card from Renegade Game Studios offered as a reward for the Season 7 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

French edition of the card found in Plato Magazine 111.

When the card first arrives in the market, All players get +1 Clank! The card costs 5 Skill, is worth 1 point, and when played, it generates 3 gold for person who played it, and all other players get +1 Clank!

Name: Sarah's Singularity
Description:
Future Sarah has fractured the timelines and it's up to you, an earlier-version Sarah, to solve missions and set things right. Bring dinosaurs to Ancient Egypt and ComiCon panelists to Feudal Japan while trying to rescue lost companions scattered in time. Put companions to work in their own times to complete missions. You've got seven time jumps to complete as many missions as possible, but watch out for paradoxes; if two or more Sarahs meet in the same time zone, everything about them will change in an instant and all your plans could go up in smoke.

In Sarah's Singularity, players select an assortment of time periods from prehistoric Pangea to ComicCon 2012 and establish a set of missions for each period. Stranded companions from far-ranging times are scattered among the chosen periods and each player gets a "Sarah Card" with special powers. Finally, players choose two secret objective cards for hidden endgame scoring and a Chronologist is selected from the gathered players.

Each round, Future Sarah visits a time period to strand another companion and the players simultaneously and secretly select a time period to jump to where they hope to solve a mission by matching icons on the mission card with icons on the stranded companion cards and the icons on their own hand of helpful companions. Typically, when the selected periods are revealed, they're resolved in chronological order. However, if two or more Sarahs (including the Future Sarah) land in the same time period, they paradox! Those player immediately turn in their Sarah Cards and get a new one at random, losing the special powers they may have planned to use to help solve the mission. The Chronologist then decides the order in which the paradoxing players gets to take their turns. The paradoxing player who goes last gets to be the new Chronologist.

Players claim solved missions as victory points. They also gain bonus points and a wild icon token for rescuing a stranded companion and hidden endgame points through their secret objective cards. After seven rounds, the points are tallied and a winner is announced.

Name: Guildbreakers: Battle for Agawan
Description:
Description from the designer:

Guildbreakers: Battle for Agawan is a two-player tower defense card game. It plays like a miniatures game, but it needs only a minimum of table space and can fit perfectly in your pocket. You assume the role of a Guild Master, scrambling to stake your claim on the valuable ore deposits of Agawan Island. You must build up your base, recruit your troops, and smash down your opponent's base before he does the same to you. This fast-paced strategy game distills concepts from miniatures games, collectible card games, and real-time strategy games into a quick and portable card game.

Battle for Agawan's streamlined game system is a card game that has no shuffling and a tactical combat game that has no board, no rulers, and no dice rolling. Instead, players can freely select cards from their own customized army pool of twenty Base and Character cards. Base cards build up your rate of production while Character cards are used for engaging in combat. Special Character abilities and stats, combined with a deterministic support-based combat system, encourage mixed forces and dynamic counterplay. Battle for Agawan uses neither grid-based maps nor measurement-based movement, instead abstracting the field of battle into four simple rows. This minimalism allows for extremely quick setup and portability while preserving the core tactical elements of movement, range, and positioning.

Name: Ninja 1987 Card Game
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This is a solo PnP ninja card game. 
Game can be played in easy and normal mode.
Easy mode is created to be accessible for the younger players (6+) and this can be a good way to keep your offspring occupied  if you need 15 minutes to do something else.
On normal difficulty this game should be challenging enough to trouble even younger players born in 1987 or before it.

Player uses Hero Cards in order to break through the horde of minions and sidekicks, trying to eliminate two villains. No book keeping, dice or counters needed.

Game is monochrome for the ease of printing. Game contains 4 sheets of card + 4 pages long rule-book.

Name: ¡Bola va!
Description:
This game haven´t got any theme.

The players have a few marbles and in their turn, they have to throw them trying to make 3 in line or more combinations. Some combinations give you differents points and the person who reach 50 points, win

Name: Soul Shard: The Awakening
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Next-Generation Role-Playing Board Game Adventure. Soul Shard is the simplest role-playing board game adventure. You can pick up to 5+ characters including mage,rogue,warrior etc.. and start your journey. You can slay enemies for gaining experience and equipment. Chat with town folk to get useful information and quests etc.. This is your game if you like Role-Playing games, simplicity. While you can play mini scenarios for shorter sessions (like mini dungeons/quest lines), also main scenario can take you away to another universe for years.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Oberth Class Card Pack
Description:
The U.S.S. Grissom is a Federation Oberth class ship.  As a card pack, it comes with cards, token and a dial.

It is a part of card pack wave 1.

Name: Arcane Academy: Advanced Arithmancy
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Expand your studies with four powerful, new assignment cards, four new tiles, and custom-molded, plastic exhaustion tokens and gems to add new challenges to your game in the Arcane Academy: Advanced Arithmancy expansion.

Name: Kill Doctor Lucky: Doctor Lucky's Mansion That is Haunted
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Doctor J. Robert Lucky wishes to sell his haunted house to a pair of unsuspecting newlyweds from across town — but the ghosts of Lucky Mansion have a different plan. They love Doctor Lucky so much, they want him to stay with them forever!

With the Doctor Lucky's Mansion That Is Haunted expansion board, the players are ghosts, so they can move through ceilings, walls, and floors! Any two rooms are connected as long as they share an edge, not just a corner. Players can see from their current room into all the connected rooms, but no farther. What's more, the board contains three secret portals that connect two rooms, represented by duplicate objects (the raven, globe, and portrait); you can move through these portals, but you can't see through them.

This game board can be folded in half to create different play spaces with at most 4-5 players in the game, or the entirety of it can be used for games with up to eight. Whenever the number of players is close to the upper limit of the board, you should probably play with the Cat; if the board seems too roomy, you should add the Dog instead.

Name: The Spooks Journey Game II: The Killer Sequel
Description:
Description from the publisher:

More Spooks are awaiting to meet you... Summer Camp is open and that means Campfire Tales will be told to Spook the little ones! Each of the 8 camp counselors tell a tale about a Spook; the Evil Wizard, real-life T-Rex, the infested Gator Swamp, Maniac in the woods, Haunted Toys, the Wicked Witch, creepy Clowns and horrifying Aliens. Will YOU be able to survive each of the Campfire Tales?

Roll the die and make your way around the game board encountering a Spook. Complete the task for each Spook to win the game! Collect items along the way to help you on your Journey. Overcome obstacles along the way that hinder your path to become the winner!

Name: Jedes Tierchen hat sein Pläsierchen!
Description:
The players have to move their three pawns on the track of their color from space 1 to space 50. Movement is determined by the "Verolette" in the center of the game board. The "Verolette" gives 8 different results, symbolized by an animal:

ant: 14 spaces forward
donky: 6 spaces back
cat: 10 spaces forward
snake: 8 spaces back
dog: 12 spaces forward
snail: 2 spaces back
bee: 16 spaces forward
pigs: 4 spaces back

From space 50 to 52 the pawns advance 1 space at the spinn of an ant or a bee. The first player to get his 3 pawns on the spaces 51 to 53 wins the game.

Name: King of Tokyo/New York: Monster Pack – King Kong
Description:
He is not happy! King Kong is ready to conquer the Empire State Building and Tokyo Tower to find his love. Will you dare cross his path, or worse, capture his beloved?

The King Kong Monster Pack adds new elements to two games: Tokyo Tower for King of Tokyo and the Empire State Building for King of New York!

Evolution cards let you play King of Tokyo and King of New York with supercharged monsters! King Kong's Evolutions work like the Evolutions in King of Tokyo: Power Up! and King of New York: Power Up! To play with King Kong's Evolutions, you need the Power Up! expansion for whichever base game you have.

One of King Kong's Evolutions introduces the Beauty card, which has two sides that have different effects according to which monster owns the card.

Part of the King of Tokyo series.

Name: HurriCount
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Easy as one-two-three. Whoever counts the hedgehogs and birds the fastest yells “Got it” and collects the harvest! The originally designed game set in compact packaging with bright an unusual animal drawings is a great solution for this fun game and complementary for acquiring the basics of mathematics. Play and get smarter. This game is played in background mode, so you won’t have to convince your child to sit down at the table. Not only will children learn how to count, but they will instantly learn to define the number of objects on a card as well, which definitely separates this method of learning from cramming in a positive light. Adding within ten can easily become second nature to your child. HurriCount is a great supplement for developing your child’s attentiveness, logic, thinking speed, and reaction time. HurriCount has an application called HurriCount Mathitude where you will get to solve problems that are even more challenging. The cards from this game can be gradually added into HurriCount, making it more difficult, and you can also use it as a standalone playing set. When buying the two games at the same time, you will be able to receive a cut little bag that you can carry the games in.

Name: Splittissimo
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Signora ordered five eighths with tomatoes!

This game will make you sweat, as you’ll be working for the famous and respected Italian pizzeria called Splittissimo. Its fussy clients love to order pizza by slices. By playing this game you'll become such an expert in fractions that you'll be second to none.

The game set is designed in a charming Italian style. It includes both rectangular cards with orders and fascinating round cards. The latter are trays with different numbers of pizza slices. Apart from cheese and olives, pizzas include tomatoes, mushrooms, and peppers in various combinations; each one can have two additional ingredients.

Splittissimo offers the fastest delivery!

There are several versions of the game.

Let’s start with the easiest one. If you’re playing with children of five and older, use only round cards. Beginner level cards are marked with one dot (to make it more challenging, you can add cards with two or three dots later). Each player takes three cards and puts them face-up in front of him; the same number of cards is placed face-up on the table (playing by the rules of a more challenging version, the players draw 4 cards and 4 cards are placed on the table) The task is to use several playing field cards to assemble a pizza , so that the number of its slices would be equal to the number of slices in one of your pizzas. Or, conversely, you can choose one of the playing field pizzas and assemble it using several of your own cards.

Playing with older kids, add the rectangular order cards. The task is to assemble the ordered pizzas using the cards on the playing field, taking into account both their size and the ingredients. To add excitement to the game, use a number of special cards, which allow you to slow down your opponents’ work and accelerate your own pace using “last minute” orders.

All versions of the game end with counting the whole pizzas that players managed to put together. In other words, the players should make whole pizzas from the slices they have, which helps them to reinforce addition of fractions once again.

Name: Etchessera
Description:
Etchessera is a chess-based abstract strategy game that utilizes draft-able armies in a medieval fantasy setting.  Before each game, players build their own chess army from a collection of 17 different pieces.  All of the original pieces from chess and checkers are available as well as several new ones such as a wizard, dragon, or guard.

During a player's turn, they choose to move or activate one of their pieces.  Many pieces are similar to classic chess pieces in which they capture others by moving onto the same square.  Some capture by jumping, and others capture via rolling a certain result on a die.

As in chess, the ultimate goal of the game is for each player to capture their opponent's King.  Similar to the classic game, there are opportunities for stale-mates that result in draws.

Name: Trans-TK (fan expansion for Trans Europa / TransAmerica)
Highlands
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Highlands is a solo boardgame set in middle ages Scotland, in a time of rival clans, factions, and kingdoms.  Play as a king/earl/jarl striving to gain reputation and power as you build your empire in the highlands.  Along the way, you will explore, decide how to expand, and encounter rival armies and a variety of creatures from the realm of the faes.

Highlands started as an attempt to create a Scythe-like solo gaming experience, but with a smaller footprint and less upkeep.  Start with a Castle, a King, and two Workers.  Then, hire more Workers, build a Cathedral, train a Soldier and a Knight, explore, encounter Faes, complete missions, and defend your Castle from the Enemy.

Highlands is played on a custom hex map 12 chess pieces, a 27 card Encounter deck, an 18 card Mission deck, and a handful of cubes.

Highlands won 4th place in the Best Overall Game category in the 2017 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

Name: Operation Icarus
Description:
Description from the publisher:
Operation Icarus is a simulation covering a hypothetical German campaign to occupy Iceland in World War 2.

Name: Fragments of Wisdom
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Theme/backstory: In 587BC the Babylonian armies of Nebuchadnezzar broke through the walls of Jerusalem, burned the city and pillaged the Temple of Yahweh. Those in the city who survived the siege were deported 1500km to Babylon.

The people of Israel are bleeding. Their capital is destroyed, they are exiled from their land and Yahweh has abandoned them, or so it seems.

Nursing broken hearts, the pious of Israel gather on the banks of the Euphrates River. They comfort each other, and turn to the writings of the prophet Jeremiah. Perhaps they will gain understanding before all their hope drains away ...

Game mechanics: Co-operative card game with a CCG/LCG feel. The box comes with all the cards you need for four starter decks (and a few other cards too). The starter decks are reasonable, but as you improve you will want to craft your own. Unlike other co-op CCG/LCGs there is no 'monster deck' or 'encounter deck' instead there is some very careful shared resource management required.

Name: Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Cerberus Occultist
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Known for their obsessive need to study, the students of House Cerberus have a tendency to delve in knowledge that is best left alone. Unfortunately, this causes some promising students to descend into madness. The truly gifted, however, learn to tame this dark knowledge and unleash it against the foes of Crystalia.

The adventurous girls of Takoashi have barely gotten into summer, and already they want to go back to school! Schooling monsters that is! Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Cerberus Occultist comes fully equipped, complete with a hero card, cast in luxurious resin as a multi-part kit.

Name: Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Siren Enforcer
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Few can resist the allure of the students of House Siren. Trained in the arts of charm, persuasion, and manipulation, graduates of House Siren go on to positions of power throughout the realms. It is a foolish adversary who dismisses a student of House Siren as a mere diplomat or sophisticate. Wielding massive hammers, these powerful students are trained to knock you out with more than their looks.

The adventurous girls of Takoashi have barely gotten into summer, and already they want to go back to school! Schooling monsters that is! Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Siren Enforcer comes fully equipped, complete with a hero card, cast in luxurious resin as a multi-part kit.

Name: Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Unicorn Diviner
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The adorable students of House Unicorn prefer to avoid combat whenever they are able. On the rare occasion an adventuring party can coax a House Unicorn student to join them, they are gifted with a unique and powerful ally. Staying at a safe distance from the fray, the House Unicorn student provides potent magical confections that delight the tastebuds and entice their party to unparalleled acts of heroism!

The adventurous girls of Takoashi have barely gotten into summer, and already they want to go back to school! Schooling monsters that is! Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Unicorn Diviner comes fully equipped, complete with a hero card, cast in luxurious resin as a multi-part kit.

Name: おにぎりさん (Onigiri-San)
Description:
In ãŠã«ãŽã‚Šã•ã‚“ã€€(Onigiri-San), players work together to make onigiri (Japanese rice balls) using cards that show seaweed, rice, or one of three different fillings.  To win, players must create one of each type of onigiri in front of each player.

On each turn, the active player must either (1) play one of their hand cards onto another player's tableau; or (2) "eat" (i.e., discard) a completed onigiri from their tableau and then discard and replace one of their hand cards.  Played cards are replaced from the draw deck.  Discarded cards are not reshuffled when the draw deck runs out.

The game ends either when a player is unable to act on their turn (a loss) or when each player has one of each nigiri in front of them (a win).

Name: Papercuts
Description:
Description from the publisher:

A Party game for the rude and well-read.

Everyone knows that the only thing better than reading a book is pretending you've read it at a party. So gather some friends, some booze, and play Papercuts, a party game for the rude and well-read. To play, the Editor reads a question card, and the Writers submit their funniest answer cards for the Editor to choose from. Then, everyone complains about how no one will publish their genius novel.

Papercuts is compatible with Cards Against Humanity and other similar games.

Name: Meine Farben und Formen
Description:
Round and square - red, yellow, blue. Where are the square, triangle and circle hidden? 
The three friends, monkey, rabbit and cat invite you to a journey through the world of colors and shapes. With colorful toys, the child first learns the basic colors and gradually acquires the most important forms. The children sort the colors apart. In the next step, the small players assign shapes. They play on one of many differen game boards, which the child himself has chosen. Where do the circle, triangle and quadrangle belong? Now the monkey, rabbit and cat have their appearance: in the combination of color and shape knowledge, the children organize the forms on different picture boards appropriately. Depending on the development step, additional shapes or the dice will come into play. Through numerous game variations the children in Meine Farben und Formen strengthen basic basic knowledge.

Name: Diggers of Gold
Description:
For 2 players. One player is in charge of the two miners, Alf and Jack, and the other player is in charge of the three outlaws.
The cards and discs should be placed appropriately on the board. Two pyragons are used. The players throw to decide who will start and the one with the highest score begins.
The men may move forwards or backwards. One man may be moved  the total number thrown or two men may be moved according to the number of each pyragon. If a red is thrown, the player must miss a turn. If a green is thrown he has another turn.

Miners.
The object of the game for the miners is to collect as many sacks of gold from their mines as they can.

Outlaws.
The object of the game for the outlaws is to rob the miners of their gold.

Winner.
The winner is the player with most gold when the mines are empty.

This one of a series of games designed to help the beginner reader learn to read words in different situations.

Name: Question Writey Downy Game
Description:
Description from the publisher:

In our opinion a successful party game should be three things: hilariously entertaining, easy enough for drunk people to understand and personally revealing. There are loads of dirty party games out there, but not many that also have a "getting to know you" element. And that's where we come in.

QWDG is pretty simple. It's a deck of personal questions that range from thought-provoking to ridiculous, awkward to obscene. When a card is drawn, everyone writes their own answer to the question. Then one person tries to correctly identify who wrote each answer.

To sum up: QWDG is a dirty party game for people who want to show off their disgusting sense of humor and prove how well they know their friends.

Name: Street Masters: Legend of Oni
Description:
Exclusive Kickstarter expansion adding a new boss, new stages and more.

Components:
1 Oni Miniature
1 Shin Oni Miniature
10 Yurei Ninja Miniature
5 Kitsune Miniatures
2 Double-sided map tiles
4 Stage Decks (84 cards)
1 Enemy Deck (21 cards)
Story Mode Cards
Reference Card
Tokens
Rulebook

Name: Street Masters: Twin Tiger
Description:
This is the expansion you've been waiting for!
As a tribute to the anniversary of our favorite arcade games, join Axel and Rhys as they take down the Onix Gang plaguing Ransom City.

Included in the expansion:
16 Miniatures
2 Fighter Decks
1 Double-sided map tile
2 Stage Decks
Tokens
1 Enemy deck
2 Hero Story decks
Rulebook

Name: Dragonfire: Adventures – Chaos in the Trollclaws
Description:
Chaos brews in the Trollclaws as gnolls, orcs, and goblins clash in conflicts that endanger the countryside. Face new Encounters and claim new Magic Items and Market cards in the second chapter of the Dragonfire Adventures!

Contents:

    30 Encounter Cards
    12 Market Cards
    9 Magic Item Cards
    5 Dragonfire Cards
    2 Character Screens
    18 Stickers
    1 Adventure
    1 Rules Sheet

Name: Lese-Memory
Description:
A cheerful introduction to reading for children 6 and over.

Lese-Memory is a memory game in which you have to find pairs made up of matched pictures, pictures and corresponding words or split syllables of a larger word.

144 cards included in the game.

Name: TradeWorlds: Smugglers Run
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This Expansion features as primary mechanic a "Push-Your-Luck" (PYL) mechanic in a "Race"-type scenario.  Players will be racing against each other to be the first player to earn 500 credits to win this NEW scenario.  During the game, players will take on a NEW and "Special" Mission called "Smuggler's Run" and in doing so may exchange cards for various tracks to UNLOCK a given dice.  With a maximum of five (5) dice which can be UNLOCKED, plus a BONUS 1D20 when you unlock two (2) or more dice results in the possibility of Scoring 60 Credits.  But as this is a Trade Mission ... You must be wary that your Tradeship does NOT get destroyed as you collect more valuable illegal Cargo during this mission while avoiding "losing it all" in the event that your Tradeship gets destroyed.

Remember this Expansion is build upon the framework of the "Planetary Expansion" and not only the "core" game.  However at this present time we feel that it may be incompatible with the Tactical Core (Future Expansion currently not available). Both expansions add a certain depth to the game which alter the way the game is played.  Because of the contrasting winning conditions, these two expansions cannot be played simultaneously.

Additionally this Expansion offers update Player Game Pads (Horizontal) which are more compatible with the NEW "Smuggler's Cache" Game Pads which are exclusive and personalized for each Faction in the game.  This also adds a bit of variability in Game Play allowing players to TRY the various Factions and their Resources for a different experience (in terms of resources).
